title: A Debate Over ‘Conversion Therapy,’ Once Widely Condemned, Is Back
summary: As more young people identify as transgender, a fight has re-emerged over therapy that questions their gender identities.

title: White House May Try to Deny Back Pay to Furloughed Federal Workers
summary: Union leaders and Democratic lawmakers say the move would run afoul of a law adopted under President Trump’s first term.

title: Flight Delays Begin as Air Traffic Staffing Shortages Worsen
summary: The delays came just hours after the transportation secretary warned that flying could be disrupted by the government shutdown.

title: Israel Marks Two-Year Anniversary of Oct. 7 in Subdued Fashion
summary: The somber milestone comes with peace talks underway, hostages from the Hamas-led attack still in Gaza, more than 67,000 Palestinians dead and Israel more isolated than ever.

title: Witkoff and Kushner Expected to Join Israel-Hamas Talks
summary: Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner, both architects of President Trump’s plan to end the war, are expected to join mediation efforts between Israel and Hamas.

title: In 2020, Trump Intervened in Portland’s Protests. They Got Even Worse
summary: Here are five lessons for cities in the president’s sights, like Chicago and Memphis, drawn from the one city targeted by Mr. Trump in his first term, Portland, Ore.

title: Trump Said He Could Invoke the Insurrection Act to Deploy Troops. Here’s What to Know.
summary: The president said he would invoke emergency powers to deploy the National Guard if “people were being killed, and courts were holding us up.”

title: Klarna, Affirm, Afterpay: How ‘Buy Now Pay Later’ Built a New Culture of Consumption
summary: ‘Buy Now, Pay Later’ has built a delirious new culture of consumption — and trapped users in a vortex of debt.

title: EU Proposes 50% Steel Tariffs, a Move to Counter Chinese Imports
summary: European officials want to sharply lower the bloc’s quota on tariff-free steel imports, while doubling levies to 50 percent, as President Trump’s tariffs create domino effects.

title: Trump to Unveil Farmer Aid as China Shuns U.S. Crops
summary: As it did in 2018, the White House plans to dole out relief funds to struggling U.S. farmers who have lost their biggest customer.

title: Gold Price Hits $4,000 an Ounce, a Sign of Turmoil and Unease
summary: The precious metal is on course for its best year since the 1970s, underscoring unease in financial markets.

title: Global Trade Growth to Slow Sharply Next Year, W.T.O. Says
summary: The World Trade Organization said trade growth had proved more resilient in 2025 than expected, but would slow next year as result of President Trump’s tariffs.

title: Parents Struggle to Find Covid Vaccines for Their Children Amid Regulatory Confusion
summary: Children under 12 need different versions of Covid vaccines, but many pharmacies and pediatricians’ offices aren’t stocking them.

title: Taking Too Much Tylenol Has Proven Risks. Trump Didn’t Talk About Those.
summary: Acetaminophen’s link to autism is unproven. But hundreds of Americans accidentally overdose on the drug each year, suffering liver damage that can require a transplant or even be fatal.

title: Saul Zabar, Smoked Fish Czar of Upper West Side, Dies at 97
summary: He led his parents’ appetizing store, Zabar’s, for more than 70 years, turning it into an institution synonymous with New York.

title: With Sébastien Lecornu’s Resignation, France Faces Increasing Turmoil
summary: The record-fast collapse of yet another government confronts President Emmanuel Macron and his country with an intensifying crisis.

title: Nobel Prize in Physics Is Awarded for Work in Quantum Mechanics
summary: John Clarke, Michel H. Devoret and John M. Martinis were recognized for work that made behaviors of the subatomic realm observable at a larger scale.

title: Winning a Nobel Prize Interrupted His Off-the-Grid Vacation
summary: Fred Ramsdell found out about his Nobel Prize nearly 12 hours after it was announced because he was on vacation in the Rockies.

title: Recruiters Use A.I. to Scan Résumés. Applicants Are Trying to Trick It.
summary: In an escalating cat-and-mouse game, job hunters are trying to fool A.I. into moving their applications to the top of the pile with embedded instructions.

title: Is A.I. Investment Getting Too Circular?
summary: Skeptics of a recent investment spree involving OpenAI and others say deals raise questions about the robustness of the artificial intelligence boom.

title: He Was Expected to Get Alzheimer’s 25 Years Ago. Why Hasn’t He?
summary: Scientists are searching for the secret in Doug Whitney’s biology that has protected him from dementia, hoping it could lead to ways to treat or prevent Alzheimer’s for many other people.

title: That Hegseth Speech on D.E.I. in the Military Was Actually Pretty Good
summary: Despite some rude provocations, he outlined a nuanced vision of the military.

title: Mamdani’s Charm Offensive and Crash Course in How to Govern
summary: Being mayor of New York City is one of the toughest jobs in politics. One glimpse of how Zohran Mamdani may seek to do it is whom he’s talking to.

title: President Trump and the Military
summary: Today, we look at how Trump melds his politics with his role as head of the armed forces.

title: 200 Animals and a 95-Year-Old Are Found Inside a Squalid Suburban Home
summary: The woman was confined to her room by clutter, and a Long Island wildlife rehabilitator faces charges. The authorities found everything from cats to voles, many of them in dire conditions.

title: Deadly Clashes Erupt Between Syrian Government Forces and Kurdish Fighters
summary: Tensions have been building over government attempts to bring the Kurdish-led region in northeastern Syria under its authority. Kurdish leaders have so far resisted.

title: Eric Adams’s Exit From the NYC Mayoral Race Isn’t Having a Major Effect on Cuomo’s Bid So Far
summary: There has been little evidence that Mayor Eric Adams’s decision to end his re-election bid has had a major effect on Andrew Cuomo’s bid to attract donors or voters.

title: 2025 National Book Award Finalists Are Announced
summary: Novels by Karen Russell and Bryan Washington are among those vying for the award in fiction, while books about Gaza, foster care and women in Russia are up for the nonfiction prize.
